text: Scott William Sloan (2 July 1954 â€“ 23 April 2019) was an Australian civil engineer and academic. He was noted for his work in the fields of geotechnical engineering and computational geomechanics. He was Professor of Civil Engineering at the University of Newcastle. In July 2015, he was named as a Fellow of the Royal Society. In January 2018, Sloan was made an Officer of the Order of Australia. He was born in Mildura, Victoria. Sloan died on 23 April 2019, at the age of 64. ==References== Category:1954 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Australian academics Category:Australian engineers Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Order of Australia Category:People from Victoria (Australia) Category:Civil engineers
title: Scott W. Sloan
